title: Album Page, "Sarcophagus, Louvre, Paris", late 19th century
medium: Brush and wash, pen and black and red ink, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 104; below right of drawing: T... in Louvre / Paris.
dimensions: 14.7 x 24.5 cm (5 13/16 x 9 5/8 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.6 cm (12 9/16 x 9 11/16 in.), irregular
description: Horizontal sheet cut down and attached to top half of mount.  Depicted is a classically ornamented sarcophagus seen in elevation from the front and side.  The sarcophagus has a very high base with a panel above of carved vegetal swags tied to the corners by carved ribbons.  In the upper center of the panel is a small plaque that reads: LVSIENAE / PRIMICENIAE / VIX  ANN XXV.  The cover has a large triangular pediment with two confronted scrolls joined at the apex.  The ends of the scrolls extend high above the corners of the pediment.  The elevation of the sarcophagus at right shows a panel with a garland suspended from the top corners.  Above the ends of the cover are seen as two bellflowers end to end.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Sarcophagus, Louvre, Paris", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Brush and wash, pen and black and red ink, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-171.
